name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

strengths: Mirror Move can return big damage
weaknesses: Mirror Move requires being attacked first
Opponent chooses switch target for Whirlwind

competitiveHistory: Pidgeotto was primarily used as a stepping stone to Pidgeot. Mirror Move could occasionally be devastating if the opponent hit Pidgeotto with a big attack and it survived, but this was inconsistent.

rulings.ruling: Whirlwind does damage first, then the opponent chooses which Benched Pokemon becomes the new Defending Pokemon.
Mirror Move only works if Pidgeotto was attacked during your opponent's last turn.
Mirror Move does the 'final result' of the attack - the actual damage dealt after all modifiers.
If the attack last turn did no damage (missed coin flip, etc.), Mirror Move does nothing.
